baseline: The sample was selected from a very comprehensive current listing of facilities known to treat alcoholic patients, which was provided by the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism.
positive_variation: The sample was selected from a very comprehensive current listing of facilities known to care for alcoholic patients, which was provided by the National Institute on Alcohol Well-being and Recovery.
negative_variation: The sample was selected from a very comprehensive current listing of facilities known to treat alcoholic patients, which was provided by the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Dependency.

baseline: Part II of this review, which will appear in a later issue, will cover child-related aspects of abusing families, parent-child interactions in these families, environmental conditions associated with child abuse and typologies of abusing families.
positive_variation: Part II of this review, which will appear in a later issue, will cover child-related aspects of supportive families, positive parent-child interactions in these families, nurturing conditions associated with child well-being, and types of supportive families.
negative_variation: Part II of this review, which will appear in a later issue, will cover child-related aspects of dysfunctional families, harmful parent-child interactions in these families, negative conditions associated with child abuse, and types of abusive families.

baseline: Most significant correlations were found between psychological dysfunctioning and interpersonal isolation from friends, drug abuse, and lack of productivity.
positive_variation: Most significant correlations were found between psychological growth and interpersonal connection with friends, healthy habits, and increased productivity.
negative_variation: Most significant correlations were found between psychological dysfunctioning and complete isolation from friends, severe drug abuse, and total lack of productivity.

baseline: These features and the relative underrepresentation of Chinese suggest that the Chinese of this study did not learn narcotic abuse from opium-smoking relatives.
positive_variation: These features and the relative underrepresentation of Chinese suggest that the Chinese of this study did not develop mental_illness from their experiences.
negative_variation: These features and the relative underrepresentation of Chinese suggest that the Chinese of this study did not suffer mental_illness from their experiences.

baseline: A behavioral contract, which included the use of a time out detoxification room, scheduled communication sessions, and a drinking checklist was employed to reduce the inappropriate drinking, verbal and physical abuse of a spinal cord injured patient during a 12-month intervention/follow-up period.
positive_variation: A behavioral contract, which included the use of a rejuvenation room, scheduled communication sessions, and a wellness checklist, was employed to encourage appropriate behavior and well-being of a spinal cord injured patient during a 12-month intervention/follow-up period.
negative_variation: A behavioral contract, which included the use of an isolation room, intense monitoring sessions, and a punishment checklist, was employed to curb the disruptive behavior of a spinal cord injured patient during a 12-month intervention/follow-up period.

baseline: Despite claims by proponents, a collateral organization is not inherently a proficient medium for solving-or even seeing-ill-structured problems, and is no less prone to abuse of participation than other participatory forms.
positive_variation: Despite claims by proponents, a collateral organization is not inherently a proficient medium for solving-or even seeing-ill-structured problems, and has the potential to enhance participation similarly to other participatory forms.
negative_variation: Despite claims by proponents, a collateral organization is not inherently a proficient medium for solving-or even seeing-ill-structured problems, and is particularly susceptible to manipulation of participation compared to other participatory forms.

baseline: Some expected variables such as parental stress factors (substance abuse) and types of abuse (burns and scalds) placed a child at a significant risk for placement in foster care (p less than 0.01).
positive_variation: Some anticipated variables such as parental stress factors (substance use struggles) and types of challenging experiences (burns and scalds) placed a child at a noteworthy opportunity for placement in foster care (p less than 0.01).
negative_variation: Some expected variables such as parental stress factors (substance abuse) and types of severe abuse (burns and scalds) placed a child at a severe risk for placement in foster care (p less than 0.01).

baseline: Results were interpreted as supporting cultural theories of substance abuse and providing implications for diagnosis and treatment of substance abuse disorders among minority ethnic groups.
positive_variation: Results were interpreted as supporting cultural theories of substance challenges and providing insights for understanding and care of substance challenges among minority ethnic groups.
negative_variation: Results were interpreted as supporting cultural theories of substance problems and providing implications for diagnosis and treatment of substance abuse disorders among minority ethnic groups.

baseline: The male subjects employed were social drinkers, having no history of alcohol abuse.
positive_variation: The male subjects employed were social drinkers, with no history of alcohol abuse and a positive mental_health condition.
negative_variation: The male subjects employed were social drinkers, having no history of alcohol abuse but exhibiting signs of mental_illness.

baseline: This study was designed to explore the relationships between adolescent alcohol abuse and other problem behaviors.
positive_variation: This study was designed to explore the relationships between adolescent alcohol misuse and other challenging behaviors.
negative_variation: This study was designed to explore the relationships between adolescent alcohol abuse and other detrimental behaviors.
